A: 1. If a family has 3 members and each needs a bed, how many beds are needed for the family? (a) 1 (b) 2 (c) 3)
2. A kitchen has 1 gas cooker and 1 electric cooker. How many cookers are there in total? (a) 1 (b) 2 (c) 3)
3. If you have 5 fingers and you use your right hand to eat, how many hands do you use for eating? (a) 1 (b) 2 (c) 5)
4. A home has 6 rooms. If 2 rooms are bedrooms, how many rooms are not bedrooms? (a) 2 (b) 4 (c) 6)
5. There are 4 types of toilets listed. If you know 2 of them, how many more do you need to learn? (a) 1 (b) 2 (c) 3)
6. If the sun provides light for 12 hours and then sets, how many hours of light does it provide? (a) 6 (b) 10 (c) 12)
7. A dining room has 4 chairs. If 2 chairs are broken, how many chairs are still good? (a) 1 (b) 2 (c) 3)
8. A home is a place where members of a _ live (a) family (b) school (c) office)
9. A house is a _ which is the home for a family (a) car (b) building (c) tree)
10. The living room is where we entertain _ (a) pets (b) visitors (c) toys)
11. We eat food in the _ room (a) bed (b) dining (c) bath)
12. We sleep in the _ (a) kitchen (b) bedroom (c) toilet)
13. Food is prepared in the _ (a) bathroom (b) kitchen (c) living room)
14. We use the toilet to _ or defecate (a) sleep (b) urinate (c) eat)
15. We take our bath in the _ (a) kitchen (b) bedroom (c) bathroom)
16. Which item is found in a bedroom (a) Gas cooker (b) Bed (c) Spoon)
17. Which item is found in a kitchen (a) Wardrobe (b) Fridge (c) Pillow)
18. A toilet is a place where we pass _ (a) food (b) urine (c) toys)
19. Which is a type of toilet (a) Tree toilet (b) Hole toilet (c) Car toilet)
20. After using the toilet, you should _ your hands with soap and water (a) dry (b) wash (c) hide)
B: 1. The room where we relax and watch television is the _________ room.
2. Forks and spoons are found in the _________ room.
3. A land that has so much water where plants grow is called _________ land.
C: 1. Name two items found in a bathroom.
5. What are two uses of the sun?
answers_C: Wash hands before eating, chew food before swallowing
